comments:
I just saved an editor buffer and received this error:

java.nio.BufferOverflowException
	at java.nio.DirectByteBuffer.put(DirectByteBuffer.java:311)
	at java.nio.DirectByteBuffer.put(DirectByteBuffer.java:290)
	at sun.nio.ch.IOUtil.write(IOUtil.java:70)
	at sun.nio.ch.FileChannelImpl.write(FileChannelImpl.java:651)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.Chunk.flush(Chunk.java:52)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.Database.flush(Database.java:501)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.PDOM.flush(PDOM.java:756)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.WritablePDOM.flush(WritablePDOM.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.WritableCIndex.flush(WritableCIndex.java:144)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.PDOMIndexerTask.parseTUs(PDOMIndexerTask.java:192)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.full.PDOMFullIndexerTask.run(PDOMFullIndexerTask.java:108)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.PDOMIndexerJob.run(PDOMIndexerJob.java:89)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)
I think this is a consequence of bug 193505, what CDT-views are you using?
Nothing special. Project view, editors, outline, make targets. I've only seen this happen once, so have no objection if you want to close as duplicate.

I found out that the problem can happen without using the IndexView, see comment #7 of bug 193505.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 193505 ***
Changing OS from Mac OS to Mac OS X as per bug 185991
